Cereal Box Art Gallery: Turn cereal boxes into a canvas for local artists to showcase their work. The boxes can be decorated with colorful paintings, drawings, or even 3D sculptures, creating a unique art gallery experience. Confidence score: 0.9

Cereal Box Storage: Create a storage solution for small items like jewelry, electronics, or office supplies using cereal boxes. Simply cut out the bottom of the box and glue it shut, then use the remaining space to store your belongings. Confidence score: 0.8

Cereal Box Greenhouse: Use cereal boxes to create a mini greenhouse for small plants. Cut out the sides of the box and poke a few holes in the bottom for drainage. Place a small pot inside and cover it with a plastic bag to create a humid environment. Confidence score: 0.7

Cereal Box Planter: Use cereal boxes as planters for small herbs or flowers. Cut out the sides of the box and poke a few drainage holes in the bottom. Fill the box with soil and plant your favorite herbs or flowers. Confidence score: 0.6

Cereal Box Fort: Create a fort or playhouse for kids using cereal boxes. Stack the boxes on top of each other and use duct tape or string to secure them together. Cut out windows and doors in the sides of the fort and add some decorations like paint or stickers. Confidence score: 0.5
